title: Franklinton teen killed in hunting accident, newspaper reports
content:
A Franklinton teen-ager was shot by his father on New Year's Eve in an apparent hunting accident on Delta National Forest in Mississippi, The Clarion-Ledger reported.
Starkey County Coroner Angela Easton confirmed to the newspaper that Cayle Mitchell Taylor, 16, was shot in the chest and killed by his father.
Steve Adcock, law-enforcement bureau chief for the Mississippi Department of Wildlife, Fisheries, and Parks, wouldn't give details because the investigation is ongoing, but he hinted that Taylor's father may have mistaken him for game.
"The main thing is, people need to be aware of their target," Adcock told the newspaper. "You can't shoot at movement. You can't shoot at shadows. You've got to be 100-percent sure of your target."
Delta National Forest comprises 61,000 acres fully contained in Sharkey County near Vicksburg, Miss.
